oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nashville City Schools, Lipscomb Elementary
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lipscomb Elementary opened in South Nashville in 1907. Before the school was built, the property held Fairfield Plantation. Following the plantation was a convent where it is thought the first Lipscomb classes may have been held. The school was named for James Lipscomb, and the first principal was W.N. Tucker. The school closed in 1960. 11 x 14 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lipscomb Elementary
Education; Elementary schools; Architecture; Schools
Nashville (Tenn.)
